main event: A bright white light was observed moving in an erratic manner over Union City, Indiana on June 7, 1960.
interesting points: The object appeared to pulse or flicker at irregular intervals, and was approximately 2-3 times as bright as a star.
The object moved in a northerly, then westerly, then southerly direction over the course of about 20 minutes before disappearing.
The witness was a male adult who provided a detailed description of the object and its movements.
The investigator was unable to identify the object or determine its cause.
The case was classified as UNIDENTIFIED.
photographs: yes, one 5x7" color photograph was included in the case file
